ping.title: Commands: `=ping`
ping.description:
**Usage:** `=ping`
**Description:** Test command to see if the bot is running or if you are bored 
**Requirements:** none

commands.title: Commands: `=commands`
commands.description:
**Usage:** `=commands [command name]`
**Description:** List commands available to you. When given the argument of a command name, gives info about that command. "Usage:" tells how to use the command. Arguments inside `<>` are required. Arguments inside `[]` are optional. "Description:" gives a discription of the command and what it does. "Requirements:" gives the requirements necesary to execute the command. 
**Requirements:** none

server.title: Commands: `=server`
server.description:
**Usage:** `=server`
**Description:** Gives information and status of the BTE: Theme Parks Minecraft server. 
**Requirements:** none

players.title: Commands: `=players`
players.description:
**Usage:** `=players`
**Description:** Lists online players in the BTE: Theme Parks Minecraft server. 
**Requirements:** none

score.title: Commands: `=score`
score.description:
**Usage:** 
`=score [Member Mention OR User ID]`
`=score give <User ID> <Integer>`
`=score reset <User ID>`
`=score delete <Enmap Key>`
**Description:** Shows your score for the Builder Progress Updates system. Also levels you up and gives rewards when you reach a certain number of points. You will ONLY level up when you yourself uses this command. If a valid argument is given, it will give the score for the indicated user, this will not level them up. Use `=help progress` to learn more. To give or take points, give a user ID and an amount of points to give. (or use a negative number to take points) Use `=score reset` to reset a user's update cooldown. Use `=score delete` to delete info from the score database.
**Requirements:** none 
**Requirements for `=score give`:** Moderator OR Trial Moderator 
**Requirements for `=score reset`:** Moderator OR Trial Moderator
**Requirements for `=score delete`:** Admin

modsay.title: Commands: `=modSay`
modsay.description:
**Usage:** `=modSay <Channel Mention> <Message>`
**Description:** Sends a the specified message in the specified channel. Confirmed by reaction with :white_check_mark:  
**Requirements:** Moderator OR Trial Moderator, "MODERATION" OR "ADMIN" channel category

nomodsay.title: Commands: `=modSay`
nomodsay.description: This command's information is a secret :eyes: Please get this command's information in either the "MODERATION" or "ADMIN" channel categories.

devcommand.title: Commands: `=devCommand`
devcommand.description:
**Usage:** `=devCommand`
**Description:** Test command. Used to test commands usable only by the bot developer. 
**Requirements:** Be the bot developer \:|

modcommand.title: Commands: `=modCommand`
modcommand.description:
**Usage:** `=modCommand`
**Description:** Test command. Used to test commands usable only by moderators and trial moderators. 
**Requirements:** Moderator OR Trial Moderator

admincommand.title: Commands: `=adminCommand`
admincommand.description:
**Usage:** `=adminCommand`
**Description:** Test command. Used to test commands usable only by admins. 
**Requirements:** Admin

reload.title: Commands: `=reload`
reload.description:
**Usage:** `=reload <command name>` OR `=reload count`
**Description:** Reloads the specified command after an edit without need to restart the bot. Can also reload the member counter. 
**Requirements:** Be the bot developer \:|

app.title: Commands: `=app`
app.description:
**Usage:** `=app <option>` 
> `=app review [user tag]` 
> `=app accept <user tag>` 
> `=app deny <user tag> <reason>` 
> `=app history [user tag OR page number]`
> `=app info <application ID>` 
**Description:** =app commands are used to review, deny, accept, view, and edit applications and their statuses. See `=help apply reviewer` for more information. 
**Requirements:** Moderator OR Trial Moderator, <#739239527431798805>

help.title: Commands: `=help`
help.description:
**Usage:** `=help [option]` 
**Description:** Gives information on the team and how it functions. Will give in-depth information on sepcified topic if option argument is given. 
**Requirements:** none

restart.title: commands: `=restart`
restart.description:
**Usage:** `=restart0`
**Description:** Restarts the bot. Clears all cache and variables in memory. 
**Requirements:** Be the bot developer \:|
